snippet.textDisplay: Even if you're horde deep on our hearth, this is the best OST of the whole game. This blasting when you approach Stormwind... probably the most impactful memory I have of the game.

snippet.textDisplay: I've had such an on and off time with this game. My first character was a Dreanei Hunter and I agree. When I first stepped onto Stormwind, I was amazed. If it wasn't for this game, I would not be as much into gaming as I am now and I want to thank my friend for making me play it back when I was 10.

snippet.textDisplay: I suppose you like alliance. I quit about 4 months or so or more, I don't know...the game just wasn't doing it for me anymore. I do miss my rogue though, blood elf subtlety/combat. Probably the most fun I've had in a while. But I played since Wrath and the game was getting old, and changing too much. I had about eight 85s, but I told Blizzard to put my account on freeze so I can't come back. I'm still on armory, though.

I do miss my rogue though, blood elf subtlety/combat. Probably the most fun I've had in a while. But I played since Wrath and the game was getting old, and changing too much. I had about eight 85s, but I told Blizzard to put my account on freeze so I can't come back. I'm still on armory, though.

snippet.textDisplay: The melody right at the start sounds very similar to Donkey Kong Country 2's title screen :)
snippet.textOriginal: The melody right at the start sounds very similar to Donkey Kong Country 2's title screen :)

snippet.textDisplay: I can't speak for Supra, but I think video game music has a special quality -because- of the stories we associate with the tracks. We're experiencing the game while we hear the music, so the emotions get tied up in the music. What a particular song sparks in your memory is half the joy of VGM, I'd say. But supra's music is awesome all on its own too - I've found great tracks from games I've never played from his uploads.
snippet.textOriginal: I can't speak for Supra, but I think video game music has a special quality -because- of the stories we associate with the tracks. We're experiencing the game while we hear the music, so the emotions get tied up in the music. What a particular song sparks in your memory is half the joy of VGM, I'd say. But supra's music is awesome all on its own too - I've found great tracks from games I've never played from his uploads.

snippet.textDisplay: It has a nordic feel to it.  Not everyone is TOO into that style, heh.  Myself, I feel the emotion in the music... love the lore and such even though some people will trash it.

snippet.textDisplay: In gameplay, WoW is just too much like an elaborate checklist for my tastes. But in all its aesthetic qualities, it blows the other MMORPGs out of the water.

snippet.textDisplay:
I was actually quite surprised at how little World of Warcraft tracks (and Blizzard tracks too) there are in this list so far. 

This one is great, and always reminds me of entering Stormwind, and doing all the business I had there. Stormwind is the best capital, no doubt, and this theme is almost best too, but the best song in this game is Thunder Bluff's theme, or perhaps The Barrens' theme.
snippet.textOriginal:
I was actually quite surprised at how little World of Warcraft tracks (and Blizzard tracks too) there are in this list so far. 

This one is great, and always reminds me of entering Stormwind, and doing all the business I had there. Stormwind is the best capital, no doubt, and this theme is almost best too, but the best song in this game is Thunder Bluff's theme, or perhaps The Barrens' theme.

snippet.textDisplay: I surprised myself when I realised that this game is actually one of my favorites of all time. It has its place in my top 10. The amount of hours I played, the number of great moments, the nice players I grouped with... it all made for such a memorable experience. I played until Wrath of the Lich King included but eventually decided it was time to move on. I have a lot of nostalgia for this game now. I'll always remember the first time I walked into Stormwind and the chant started at 1:36.
snippet.textOriginal: I surprised myself when I realised that this game is actually one of my favorites of all time. It has its place in my top 10. The amount of hours I played, the number of great moments, the nice players I grouped with... it all made for such a memorable experience. I played until Wrath of the Lich King included but eventually decided it was time to move on. I have a lot of nostalgia for this game now. I'll always remember the first time I walked into Stormwind and the chant started at 1:36.
